"I never thought I would ever see a blackboard someday," says Marie, but a @WFP / @FAO literacy course empowered her & other women in the Democratic Republic of the Congo with new skills. #GlobalGoals 
https://t.co/cQDCM4eOmy

With freshwater extremely scarce and sewage disposal systems in disrepair, the number of cholera cases in Yemen continues to climb. 

Here's how @FAO is working with partners to combat cholera. #WorldWaterWeek https://t.co/KyCcctah9y
New technologies & innovation are having profound impact on the #GlobalGoals, say participants at UN Civil Society Conference in Salt Lake City, Utah. #UNCSC2019 https://t.co/Vf6YFBWcIk

.@Refugees renews its call for urgent action to save lives after at least 40 people drown following a shipwreck off the coast of Libya. 

Around 900 people have lost their lives attempting to cross the Mediterranean in 2019. #WithRefugees https://t.co/vD35fVhikJ

Achieving safe drinking water💧 & sanitation 🚽 for all is one of the #GlobalGoals. 

During #WorldWaterWeek, see the progress that has been made so far and what more needs to be done. https://t.co/OCFYALRkwR https://t.co/Ht19pTlQVF

“Behind each of these numbers, there are real people, with real lives. That’s why I’m here: it’s about how we as humans can help each other.” 

Meet Yumiko, one of the brave women humanitarians making a difference with @Refugees in Syria. #WithRefugees https://t.co/m1gzsDe2NF

More than 325K Palestine refugee students in Gaza & the West Bank have returned to school. @UNRWA is helping them reach their dreams & achieve their full potential. https://t.co/lqDyoH5n9D https://t.co/t4nCa75fuW

The Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has affected thousands of people over the last year. 

The UN & partners are continuing to work to save lives and stop the disease. https://t.co/DCDT6YunD3 https://t.co/aXmEz7pzKC

#CITESCoP18 World Wildlife Conference continues this week to address wildlife crime & to strengthen trade rules for elephants, exotic pets, fisheries, timber & more. 

Follow @CITES for updates. https://t.co/yBuZCe6qL2  #GlobalGoals https://t.co/eUO4hZ2ONA

Water scarcity is one of the greatest challenges of our time. 

If we don't change our habits now, 2/3 of the 🌍's population could be living in water-stressed countries by 2025. 
 
@FAO explains. #WorldWaterWeek 
https://t.co/Kax6LpgD2V

The vital role of civil society in solving the world's challenges & achieving the #GlobalGoals is stressed as UN Civil Society Conference gets underway in Salt Lake City, Utah. https://t.co/4Ee9w47ywp #UNCSC2019 https://t.co/9bTHE8Solm

Meet Queery the 🐕, @UNMAS  team member helping to keep civilians safe. 

On Monday's #InternationalDogDay, more about how these specially-trained dogs are working side-by-side with UN colleagues around the world: https://t.co/YT5n1sspjq https://t.co/VtHmluUAk8

2 years after hundreds of thousands of Rohingya refugees fled from Myanmar to Bangladesh, @Refugees continues supporting their access to adequate nutrition, shelter, sanitation, healthcare & education. #WithRefugees https://t.co/uY6SAndPEJ
📸: The Ocean Art Installation at UNHQ in NYC draws attention to marine pollution. Here is what you can do for #CleanSeas: https://t.co/giEmSOT0im https://t.co/AKW2uUMnpu

Happening this week: UN Civil Society Conference in Salt Lake City, Utah with special focus on #GlobalGoals and inclusive & sustainable cities & communities. Follow #UNCSC2019 for updates. https://t.co/QhXP4Hr0xq https://t.co/KsMf24oRSk
Starts on Monday at @UNGeneva: Committee on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (through 20 September). https://t.co/4A9lZcSdPL https://t.co/W8cw2cPuy5
Happening this week: International Day against Nuclear Tests, International Day of the Victims of Enforced Disappearances & more. Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cv967 https://t.co/lof6fvV9Gx

Senior leaders with vision & courage are being sought for leadership roles with @UNPeacekeeping operations. Women with political & management experience are especially encouraged to apply. https://t.co/V3kmKKpa7y #GlobalCall2019 https://t.co/67pc7QMPlc

Healthy humans need a healthy planet to survive and prosper. 

More from @UNDP on why urgent #ClimateAction is needed to protect decades of progress in global health. https://t.co/H0YilGqzrE

⌚️ Maternity & parental leave
💰 Benefits & leave provisions
🤝 Accessible childhood education & elder care

@UN_Women calls for more support for #FamiliesOfToday. https://t.co/ZzImnBrAHt https://t.co/1E4vjs5UGA

Every child deserves to belong. 

@Refugees warns that stateless children may face a lifetime of exclusion and discrimination, including limited access to education and healthcare. https://t.co/2aXIx23XrZ #WithRefugees https://t.co/ptHBjOm7Ms
Over 50 million tonnes of e-waste are thrown away every year. Proper waste management could benefit the environment and boost job creation. via @ILO https://t.co/O34QscUVW0

Energy efficiency at home is key for protecting the planet. 

Join @ElyxYak and & take #ClimateAction by unplugging appliances when they’re not in use. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV #ActNow https://t.co/XqmFXamgDO

"No matter what the situation looks like, we must serve the people & their communities with respect," says Hiroko Hirahara, one of the many brave women #ServingForPeace with @unmissmedia. https://t.co/UlEeT3qHhK

Wala Matari is a terrorism survivor from Cameroon. She is one of many people who are rebuilding their lives with support from the UN. 🎧 Listen to her & others talk about #SurvivingTerrorism. https://t.co/Uw0k3GZykw https://t.co/f2Xu1jeJdx

More than 4 million Venezuelans have left their homes. 

@Refugees is calling for greater international support for the host countries & aid agencies working to meet their daily needs: https://t.co/efArvtKZcc https://t.co/t8haP8sNu2

The devastating Ebola epidemic in West Africa resulted in 11,000+ deaths & prompted major changes in how the world responds to health emergencies. 

Here's what @WHO & partners are doing differently in the current outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo. 
https://t.co/IZJrOi6HBv

4,000+ people participated in the Latin America & Caribbean Climate Week, which closed with calls for more ambitious #ClimateAction and stronger collaboration. https://t.co/T7VU4Hn6Jm #LACClimateWeek https://t.co/b1nyolNyuK

YOU have the power to tackle the climate crisis.

Small changes in our habits - like refusing single-use plastic bags and instead bringing your own - can make a big difference. Join @ElyxYak and #ActNow: https://t.co/M9TnavHxS6 #ClimateAction https://t.co/tlJRZsJiTp

Democratic Republic of the Congo: 8,500 refugees returning home thanks to improved security in Kasai province. @Refugees is providing humanitarian assistance to the returnees. #WithRefugees https://t.co/EsZvpM0Vu8

Accelerated research and development in prevention & treatment needed to #EndMalaria. New @WHO report also stresses importance of affordable healthcare and more efficient response capabilities: https://t.co/e1zsaAyHLG https://t.co/F43WoyyBHr

School closures have tripled due to rising insecurity in conflict-affected areas of West & Central Africa. @UNICEF is working to provide alternative learning opportunities for some of the 1.9 million children out of school. #ChildrenUnderAttack https://t.co/kVbiJI6yRC

Some of our favorite hashtags to follow on #HashtagDay & every day: 

#UNGA 🕊

#ForMigration 🌍

#ZeroHunger 🍚

"The transatlantic slave trade was one of history’s most appalling manifestations of human barbarity." -- @antonioguterres on Friday's #RememberSlavery Day. More from @UNESCO: https://t.co/ETh08YvRu7 https://t.co/FDOML31wrE

Only 30 days until world leaders gather at the #ClimateAction Summit at UNHQ in NYC.

On Friday's #RememberSlavery Day, we pay homage to all who fought the injustice of the slave trade. https://t.co/ETh08YegCz https://t.co/jNKiQD7pX1
These young innovators are using technology to help achieve the #GlobalGoals the Arab region through @UNDP's Youth Leadership Programme. https://t.co/1z5LgT1V5u #Youth2030 https://t.co/gCfpQJIo2y

Microplastics are everywhere, including in our drinking water, food and air. @WHO calls for more research into microplastics and a crackdown on plastic pollution. https://t.co/k2KCeW3UxL #BeatPlasticPollution https://t.co/U3X2E3Vue9

NEWS: UN independent fact-finding mission on Myanmar calls for justice for victims of sexual & gender-based violence used to terrorize & punish ethnic minorities. https://t.co/Civy6TDbRC https://t.co/rZPI66ms3q

"We all have a responsibility to look out for each other, to respect differences and to promote peaceful coexistence." -- @antonioguterres on Thursday's 1st-ever International Day for Victims of Violence Based on Religion or Belief. https://t.co/8CLzJFdqeh https://t.co/KdZzAtdHRP

Over 50% of the world’s refugees are children. 

@Refugees explains the challenges refugee kids face when fleeing home alone. https://t.co/OVIBf7Lzyw  #WithRefugees https://t.co/dIOFwlQRwQ

"I am here to say with a full heart: You are not alone. The world is with you." -@antonioguterres during visit to New Zealand mosques following terrorist attacks earlier this year.

Thursday is Int'l Day for Victims of Violence Based on Religion or Belief.
https://t.co/1Ue9Fdu90R
📸: #TBT to the Foucault Pendulum at UNHQ in NYC in July 1969. The 200-pound sphere offers visual proof of the rotation of the earth. https://t.co/iigd6n9ss3 https://t.co/rUfV18SUV8

💡Switching off lights, even for a few seconds, can save more energy than it takes for the light to go on, regardless of the bulb type.

Join @ElyxYak and #ActNow because small changes in habits can make a big difference. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n #ClimateAction https://t.co/RuZ1xicdEW

Violence against individuals on the basis of religion or belief is a human rights violation.

Thursday is the 1st-ever Int'l Day for Victims of Violence Based on Religion or Belief. https://t.co/I76EAA7eG3 #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/HSu9uUVqMq

They are film makers, vehicle mechanics, and much more. Meet 5 women who are defying the odds and inspiring others in the world's largest refugee settlement in Kenya. via @UN_Women

Meet some of the women making a difference with @WFP in South Sudan. https://t.co/JTn2d2D5hf

"Make your voices powerful."

Restraint & genuine dialogue urgently needed to avoid major confrontation in Middle East, UN senior official warns Security Council. https://t.co/sYA2uLB1sO

Worsening water quality is eliminating 1/3 of potential economic growth in some countries.

The spread of measles worldwide is straining health care systems & leading to serious illness, disability & deaths.

Yet measles can be prevented with two doses of a safe & effective vaccine.

More from @WHO: https://t.co/KIGXbQC79m #VaccinesWork https://t.co/ZToQMf279V

"Those who attack the United Nations want to make us afraid, feel weak & to retreat. Those we honour today inspire us to be bold & determined to go forward." 

-- @AminaJMohammed remembers the UN colleagues we lost in the 2003 bombing in Baghdad. https://t.co/ESut9P5kqV #WHD2019 https://t.co/PRL1PkvOmb

Nationality is not a privilege, it's a human right.

@Refugees works to help ensure every person on the planet is able to fulfill their right to a nationality. https://t.co/Nsc5mXMKfR #WithRefugees https://t.co/92U8ylTWrp

#WomenHumanitarians are doing vital, lifesaving work to help people affected by crises. On Monday's #WHD2019, and every day, we honour all they do to make our world a better place. https://t.co/kHtIZ9kCfo https://t.co/JUiPq0hwbA
Happening this week: #WHD2019, #SurvivingTerrorism Day, #RememberSlavery Day & more. Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cdxHx https://t.co/sQYeee19YW

Over the past 20 years, more than 90% of disasters were climate-related.

We need urgent and transformative #ClimateAction. Now. https://t.co/CMV2SQYpzX https://t.co/vacqYsOSru

Sunday marks one year since the passing of former UN Secretary-General @kofiannan, regarded by so many around the world as a guiding force for good.

Today, and every day, we remember him. https://t.co/flkeJ4yYrz https://t.co/rFaeeyqpXT

Access to safe drinking water is a daily struggle in Petare, one of Venezuela's most populated neighborhoods, with residents resorting to collecting rainwater for the basic essentials.

Here's how @UNICEF is helping improve the water supply. https://t.co/zG2SCLG6f8

Water pollution can threaten livelihoods, compromise human health and devastate marine environments.

@UNOPS is helping countries taking on water pollution at its source. https://t.co/UDUYMPoEXv #GlobalGoals

Simple steps can lead to a healthier lifestyle:

🍅 Eat fruits & vegetables
🍔 Avoid foods high in fat
🍩 Cut back on sugar
🍽️ Reduce salt
💧 Drink lots of water

Temperatures in the Sahel rise 1.5 times faster than the global average. Despite the multitude of threats posed by the climate crisis, @UNDP spotlights the enduring hope & enormous potential in the region: https://t.co/s0w6ts5LbR #ClimateAction https://t.co/pZz7nydce1
